projectPurpose: To provide a dedicated debugging tool for developers working with the Rust programming language on Linux systems utilizing the x86-64 architecture.

alternatives.name: GDB
alternatives.license: Open Source (GNU General Public License v3.0 or later)
mainFeatures: Supports multiple programming languages including Rust

alternatives.name: LLDB
alternatives.license: Open Source (Apache License 2.0 with LLVM Exceptions)
mainFeatures: Leverages LLVM infrastructure (Clang expression parser, LLVM disassembler)
C++ and Python APIs for scripting
Supports multiple programming languages including Rust

alternatives.name: Valgrind
alternatives.license: Open Source (GNU General Public License v2)
mainFeatures: Memory error detection (e.g., memory leaks, buffer overflows)

alternatives.name: edb-debugger
mainFeatures: Uses ptrace API and Capstone disassembly library

marketPositioning: BugStalker is positioned as a specialized debugger specifically for the Rust programming language on the Linux x86-64 platform. While general-purpose debuggers like GDB and LLDB offer Rust support as part of their broader language and architecture coverage, BugStalker's focused scope suggests a potential for deeper integration with Rust's unique language features and tooling, aiming to provide a more tailored and potentially streamlined debugging experience for Rust developers within its specific target environment compared to more general alternatives.
